remarks: Write a sum over a two-dimensional region as a double sum.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2014.)  Obsolete version of ~ gsumpt as of 8-Jun-2019.  (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
gsum2dOLD.b $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
gsum2dOLD.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
gsum2dOLD.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. CMnd ) $.
gsum2dOLD.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. V ) $.
gsum2dOLD.r $e |- ( ph -> Rel A ) $.
gsum2dOLD.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. W ) $.
gsum2dOLD.s $e |- ( ph -> dom A C_ D ) $.
gsum2dOLD.f $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> B ) $.
gsum2dOLD.w $e |- ( ph -> ( `' F " ( _V \ { .0. } ) ) e. Fin ) $.
gsum2dOLD $p |- ( ph -> ( G gsum F ) = ( G gsum ( j e. D |-> ( G gsum ( k e. ( A " { j } ) |-> ( j F k ) ) ) ) ) ) $.
$d .0. j k $.
$d A j k $.
$d B j k $.
$d D j k $.
$d F j k $.
$d G j k $.
$d j k ph $.
